required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prophylaxis Study of Recombinant Factor VIII Manufactured Protein-Free (rAHF-PFM) in Patients With Hemophilia A
clinical_study.official_title: Advate Antihemophilic Factor (Recombinant), Plasma/Albumin Free Method (ADVATE rAHF-PFM): A Phase 4 Study Comparing Two Prophylactic Regimens in Subjects With Severe or Moderately Severe Hemophilia A

brief_summary.textblock: The primary purpose of this randomized, two-arm parallel clinical study in 66 previously treated patients with severe or moderately severe hemophilia A is to compare the rate of bleeding episodes for standard prophylaxis (20-40 IU/kg every 48 ± 6 hours; actual dose determined by the investigator) with that of alternate prophylaxis (20-80 IU/kg every 72 + 6 hours; actual dose determined by Baxter utilizing an algorithm and the patient's pharmacokinetic data). The rates of bleeding episodes for the on-demand regimen and the prophylaxis regimens will also be compared for the cross-over portion of the study. Enrolled patients will be treated originally on demand for a period of 6 months and then they will be randomized into one of the prophylaxis arms. Prophylactic treatment will last for a period of 12 months +/- 2 weeks.

primary_outcome.measure: Mean Transformed Annualized Bleed Rate Estimates From Each of the 1-year Prophylaxis Regimens
primary_outcome.description: Participants were Randomized to Receive 1 of the 2 Following Prophylaxis Regimens (Study Part 2): Standard prophylaxis (20-40 IU/kg (every 48 ±6 hour), exact regimen determined by investigator) PK-driven prophylaxis (20-80 IU/kg (every 72 ±6 hour), exact regimen determined by sponsor) Annualized bleed rates were transformed using the square root of the number of bleeding episodes observed (X = bleeds/year), X' = √(X + 0.5). This transformation was performed to stabilize the variance and align the sample distribution with the assumption of normality inherent in using the t-test.

primary_outcome.measure: Median Annualized Bleed Rate Estimates From Each of the 1 Year Prophylaxis Regimens
primary_outcome.description: Participants were Randomized to Receive 1 of the 2 Following Prophylaxis Regimens (Part 2 of the study): Standard prophylaxis- infusions every 48 ±6 hours, dosed at 20 to 40 IU/kg. PK-driven prophylaxis- infusions every 72 ±6 hours dosed at 20 to 80 IU/kg.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Difference of Transformed Annualized Bleeding Rate Between On-Demand and Standard Prophylaxis Treatment Regimens
secondary_outcome.time_frame: On-demand 6 months (± 2 weeks); followed by Prophylaxis 12 months (± 2 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Annualized bleed rates were transformed using the square root of the number of bleeding episodes observed (X bleeds/year), X' = √(X + 0.5). This transformation was performed to stabilize the variance and align the sample distribution with the assumption of normality inherent in using the paired t-test. Mean Difference of Transformed Annualized Bleeding Rate (TABR) = (On-Demand Treatment TABR) - (Standard Prophylaxis Treatment TABR). Participants from the On-Demand portion of the study were subsequently randomized to either Standard Prophylaxis or PK-Driven Prophylaxis, (i.e the same participants were analyzed across the two measurement time periods).

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Difference of Transformed Annualized Bleeding Rate Between On-Demand and PK-Driven Prophylaxis Treatment Regimens
secondary_outcome.time_frame: On-demand 6 months (± 2 weeks); followed by Prophylaxis 12 months (± 2 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Annualized bleed rates were transformed using the square root of the number of bleeding episodes observed (X bleeds/year), X' = √(X + 0.5). This transformation was performed to stabilize the variance and align the sample distribution with the assumption of normality inherent in using the paired t-test. Mean Difference of Transformed Annualized Bleeding Rate (TABR) = (On-Demand Treatment TABR) - (PK-Driven Prophylaxis Treatment TABR) Participants from the On-Demand portion of the study were subsequently randomized to either Standard Prophylaxis or PK-Driven Prophylaxis, (i.e the same participants were analyzed across the two measurement time periods).

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Difference of Transformed Annualized Bleeding Rate Between On-Demand and Any Prophylaxis Treatment Regimens
secondary_outcome.time_frame: On-demand 6 months (± 2 weeks); Prophylaxis 12 months (± 2 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Annualized bleed rates were transformed using the square root of the number of bleeding episodes observed (X bleeds/year), X' = √(X + 0.5). This transformation was performed to stabilize the variance and align the sample distribution with the assumption of normality inherent in using the paired t-test. Mean Difference of Transformed Annualized Bleeding Rate (TABR) = (On-Demand Treatment TABR) - (Any Prophylaxis Treatment TABR). Any Prophylaxis = Standard or PK-Driven Prophylaxis Participants from the On-Demand portion of the study were subsequently randomized to either Standard Prophylaxis or PK-Driven Prophylaxis, (i.e the same participants were analyzed across the two measurement time periods).

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Weight-Adjusted Dose of rAHF-PFM Used Per Year for Each Prophylaxis Arm
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 months ±2 weeks
secondary_outcome.description: Participants were Randomized to Receive 1 of the 2 Following Prophylaxis Regimens (Part 2 of the study): Standard prophylaxis- infusions every 48 ±6 hours, dosed at 20 to 40 IU/kg. PK-driven prophylaxis- infusions every 72 ±6 hours dosed at 20 to 80 IU/kg.

secondary_outcome.measure: Bleeding Episodes Treated With 1 to ≥4 Infusions
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the study period (4 years and 5 months)
secondary_outcome.description: The number of bleeding episodes treated with 1, 2, 3, or ≥4 infusions of rAHF-PFM to achieve adequate hemostasis

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of Hemostasis for Treatment of Bleeding Episodes
secondary_outcome.time_frame: On-demand 6 months (± 2 weeks); Prophylaxis 12 months (± 2 weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Total Area Under the Curve (AUC)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pharmacokinetic evaluations: 30 minutes pre-infusion up to 48 hours post-infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Total AUC estimated by AUC 0-48h plus an area extrapolated from the log-linear regression model

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pharmacokinetic evaluations: 30 minutes pre-infusion up to 48 hours post-infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the factor VIII (FVIII) plasma concentration versus time curve (AUC) from 0 to 48 hours estimated using the linear trapezoidal method

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Plasma Concentration (C-max)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Within 1 hour post-infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Maximal Factor VIII Concentration After Infusion

secondary_outcome.measure: Adjusted Incremental Recovery (IR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes pre-infusion to 48 hours post-infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Change in factor VIII concentration from pre- to post-infusion at initial and termination study visits. Adjusted IR defined as: [Cmax (IU/dL) - pre-infusion FVIII (IU/dL)]/dose (IU/kg)

secondary_outcome.measure: Terminal Half-life
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pharmacokinetic evaluations: 30 minutes pre-infusion up to 48 hours post-infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Computed from the regression slope in the terminal phase of the model. Terminal half life is the time it takes for the plasma concentration or the amount of drug in the body to be reduced by 50%.

secondary_outcome.measure: Weight-Adjusted Clearance
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pharmacokinetic evaluations: 30 minutes pre-infusion up to 48 hours post-infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Computed as the weight-adjusted dose divided by total AUC

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Residence Time
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pharmacokinetic evaluations: 30 minutes pre-infusion up to 48 hours post-infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Computed as total Area Under the Moment Curve (AUMC) divided by the total AUC

secondary_outcome.measure: Volume of Distribution at Steady State
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pharmacokinetic evaluations: 30 minutes pre-infusion up to 48 hours post-infusion
secondary_outcome.description: Computed as weight-adjusted clearance * mean residence time

secondary_outcome.measure: Factor VIII Inhibitor Development
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout study period (4 years and 5 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of treated participants who developed factor VIII inhibitors

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With AEs Related to Investigational Product (IP)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout study period (4 years and 5 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of treated participants with AEs judged to be possibly or probably related to treatment with IP

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Reported ≥1 AE Regardless of Relatedness to Investigational Product (IP)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout study period (4 years and 5 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of treated participants with 1 or more AE regardless of relatedness to IP

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Reported ≥1 AE Regardless of Relatedness to IP by Treatment Regimen
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the study period (4 years and 5 months)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With SAEs by Preferred MedDRA Term and Treatment Regimen
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the study period (4 years and 5 months)

secondary_outcome.measure: AEs With Onset ≤1 Hour Following the End of an Infusion, Regardless of Relatedness
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout study period (4 years and 5 months)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Severe SAEs and Severe Non-SAEs by Preferred MedDRA Term and Treatment Regimen
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Throughout the study period (4 years and 5 months)
secondary_outcome.description: This outcome is focused only on SEVERE SAEs and SEVERE non-SAEs

secondary_outcome.measure: Baseline Health-related Quality of Life (HRQoL) Scores: PF, RP, BP, GH, VT, SF, RE, MH, PCS, and MCS
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline
secondary_outcome.description: Physical Functioning (PF); Role Limitation Due to Physical Health (RP); Bodily Pain (BP); General Health (GH); Vitality (VT); Social Functioning (SF); Role Limitation Due to Emotional Problems (RE); Mental Health (MH), Physical Component Score (PCS); Mental Component Score (MCS). Baseline SF-36v1 Scores, where data available. Scores range 0-100, higher scores represent better health. There is no total overall score; scoring is done for subscores and summary scores. The raw data from the SF-36 items were transformed to norm based scores for each of the 8 HRQoL/SF-36 health domain scores.

secondary_outcome.measure: Health-related Quality of Life (HRQoL) Scores: PF, RP, BP, GH, VT, SF, RE, MH, PCS, and MCS at the End of Treatment Regimens
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of on-demand treatment period (6 months) and at study termination (approximately 18 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Physical Functioning (PF); Role Limitation Due to Physical Health (RP); Bodily Pain (BP); General Health (GH); Vitality (VT); Social Functioning (SF); Role Limitation Due to Emotional Problems (RE); Mental Health (MH), Physical Component Score (PCS); Mental Component Score (MCS). Baseline SF-36v1 Scores, where data available. Scores range 0-100, higher scores represent better health. There is no total overall score; scoring is done for subscores and summary scores. The raw data from the SF-36 items were transformed to norm based scores for each of the 8 HRQoL/SF-36 health domain scores.

secondary_outcome.measure: HRQoL Scores Change From On-Demand Treatment Regimen Period Through Prophylaxis Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of on-demand treatment period (6 months) and at study termination (approximately 18 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Differences in health domain scores = (End of on-demand treatment) - (End of prophylaxis regimen). A negative value for the median difference equates to a larger domain score for the prophylaxis regimen Physical Functioning (PF); Role Limitation Due to Physical Health (RP); Bodily Pain (BP); General Health (GH); Vitality (VT); Social Functioning (SF); Role Limitation Due to Emotional Problems (RE); Mental Health (MH), Physical Component Score (PCS); Mental Component Score (MCS). Scores range 0-100, higher scores represent better health. There is no total overall score; scoring is done for subscores and summary scores. The raw data from the SF-36 items were transformed to norm based scores for each of the 8 HRQoL/SF-36 health domain scores.

secondary_outcome.measure: Bodily Pain HRQoL Scores Change From On-Demand Period Through Prophylaxis Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of on-demand treatment period (6 months) and at study termination (approximately 18 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Change = (End of on-demand treatment) - (End of prophylaxis regimen). A negative value for the median difference equates to a larger domain score for the prophylaxis regimen. Scores range 0-100, higher scores represent better health. There is no total overall score; scoring is done for subscores and summary scores. The raw data from the SF-36 items were transformed to norm based scores.

secondary_outcome.measure: Physical Component Scores (PCS) HRQoL Scores Change From On-Demand Period Through Prophylaxis Period
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of on-demand treatment period (6 months) and at study termination (approximately 18 months)
secondary_outcome.description: Change = (End of on-demand treatment) - (End of prophylaxis regimen) A negative value for the median difference equates to a larger domain score for the prophylaxis regimen. Scores range 0-100, higher scores represent better health. There is no total overall score; scoring is done for subscores and summary scores. The raw data from the SF-36 items were transformed to norm based scores.

intervention.description: Standard prophylaxis: 20-40 IU/kg every 48+/-6 hours, actual dose determined by investigator
PK-driven prophylaxis: 20-80 IU/kg every 72+/-6 hours, actual dose determined by Baxter using an algorithm and the patient´s pharmacokinetic data

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The subject has severe or moderately severe hemophilia A as defined by a baseline factor VIII level <= 2% of normal, as tested at screening
- The subject has a documented history of at least 150 exposure days to factor VIII concentrates (either plasma-derived or recombinant)
- The subject is within 7 to 65 years of age
- The subject has a Karnofsky performance score > (greater than) 60
- The subject is human immunodeficiency virus negative (HIV-) or is HIV+ with a CD4 count >= 400 cells/mm³ (CD4 count determined at screening, if necessary)
- The subject has been on a documented on-demand treatment regimen for at least 12 months immediately prior to enrollment
- The subject has a documented history (e.g. in medical charts or dispensing information, or signed investigator statement) of at least 8 joint hemorrhages in the 12 months immediately prior to enrollment
- The subject resides within the coverage area of the mobile compliance device; coverage area will be determined at screening
- The subject or the subject's legally authorized representative has provided written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- The subject has a known hypersensitivity to factor VIII concentrates or mouse or hamster proteins
- The subject has a history of factor VIII inhibitors with a titer >= 0.6 BU (by Bethesda or Nijmegen assay) at any time prior to screening
- The subject has a detectable factor VIII inhibitor at screening, with a titer >= 0.4 BU (by Nijmegen Assay) in the central laboratory
- The subject has severe chronic liver disease as evidenced by, but not limited to, any of the following: International Normalized Ratio (INR) > 1.4, hypoalbuminemia, portal vein hypertension including presence of otherwise unexplained splenomegaly and history of esophageal varices.
- The subject has been diagnosed with an inherited or acquired hemostatic defect other than hemophilia A (e.g., qualitative platelet defect or von Willebrand's Disease)
- The subject has been treated during the last sixty (60) days prior to or is being treated at screening/enrollment with an immunomodulating drug.
- The subject has participated in another investigational study within thirty (30) days of enrollment
- The subject has previously participated in a clinical study with rAHF-PFM
- The subject's clinical condition may require a major surgery (defined as moderate to critical risk and perioperative blood loss ≥ 500 mL) during the period of the subject's participation in the study
- The subject is female of childbearing potential with a positive pregnancy test

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants were enrolled at 21 European and 9 United States clinical sites beginning January 2006 and completing in June 2010
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: 82 participants were enrolled and screened. 7 were screen failures, 1 was withdrawn for non-compliance, and 1 requested withdrawal. Therefore, 73 of the 82 enrolled were exposed to investigational product in the first part of the study (on-demand treatment).

group.title: All Study Participants
group.description: Participants first underwent an open-label pharmacokinetic (PK) evaluation of rAHF-PFM. 48 hours after the initial PK study, a 6 month period of on-demand treatment was conducted (Part 1). After completing the on-demand treatment, participants were randomized to 1 of 2 prophylactic regimens for 12 months ±2 weeks (Part 2). The standard prophylactic regimen was dosed at 20 to 40 IU/kg every 48 ±6 hours, and the PK-driven prophylaxis regimen was dosed at 20 to 80 IU/kg every 72 ±6 hours.

group.title: PK-Driven Prophylaxis
group.description: The PK-driven prophylaxis regimen was dosed at 20 to 80 IU/kg of rAHF-PFM every 72 ±6 hours

group.title: Standard Prophylaxis
group.description: The standard prophylactic regimen was dosed at 20 to 40 IU/kg of rAHF-PFM every 48 ±6 hours

participants_list.participants: Participants were randomized to PK-Driven or Standard Prophylaxis after Part 1 (On-Demand Regimen)
Participants were randomized to PK-Driven or Standard Prophylaxis after Part 1 (On-Demand Regimen)

period.title: End of Part 1, But Prior to Prophylaxis

participants_list.participants: Participants were randomized to PK-Driven or Standard Prophylaxis after Part 1 (On-Demand Regimen)
Participants were randomized to PK-Driven or Standard Prophylaxis after Part 1 (On-Demand Regimen)
Participants were randomized to PK-Driven or Standard Prophylaxis after Part 1 (On-Demand Regimen)

group.title: All Study Participants
group.description: Participants first underwent an open-label evaluation of rAHF-PFM PK. 48 hours after the initial PK study, a 6 month period of on-demand treatment was conducted (Part 1). After completing the on-demand treatment, participants were randomized to 1 of 2 prophylactic regimens for 12 months ±2 weeks (Part 2). The standard prophylactic regimen was dosed at 20 to 40 IU/kg every 48 ±6 hours, and the PK-driven prophylaxis regimen was dosed at 20 to 80 IU/kg every 72 ±6 hours.

measure.title: Age
Sex: Female, Male

outcome.title: Mean Transformed Annualized Bleed Rate Estimates From Each of the 1-year Prophylaxis Regimens
outcome.description: Participants were Randomized to Receive 1 of the 2 Following Prophylaxis Regimens (Study Part 2): Standard prophylaxis (20-40 IU/kg (every 48 ±6 hour), exact regimen determined by investigator) PK-driven prophylaxis (20-80 IU/kg (every 72 ±6 hour), exact regimen determined by sponsor) Annualized bleed rates were transformed using the square root of the number of bleeding episodes observed (X = bleeds/year), X′ = √(X + 0.5). This transformation was performed to stabilize the variance and align the sample distribution with the assumption of normality inherent in using the t-test.
outcome.time_frame: 12 months ±2 weeks

group.title: PK-Driven Prophylaxis
group.description: PK-driven prophylaxis regimen dosed at 20 to 80 IU/kg every 72 ±6 hours

group.title: Standard Prophylaxis
group.description: Standard prophylaxis regimen dosed at 20 to 40 IU/kg every 48 ±6 hours

measure.title: Mean Transformed Annualized Bleed Rate Estimates From Each of the 1-year Prophylaxis Regimens
measure.description: Participants were Randomized to Receive 1 of the 2 Following Prophylaxis Regimens (Study Part 2): Standard prophylaxis (20-40 IU/kg (every 48 ±6 hour), exact regimen determined by investigator) PK-driven prophylaxis (20-80 IU/kg (every 72 ±6 hour), exact regimen determined by sponsor) Annualized bleed rates were transformed using the square root of the number of bleeding episodes observed (X = bleeds/year), X′ = √(X + 0.5). This transformation was performed to stabilize the variance and align the sample distribution with the assumption of normality inherent in using the t-test.

analysis.groups_desc: A t-test was used to compare the means of the transformed data. The null-hypothesis tested was H0: X'A(PK-driven prophylaxis) - X'B (standard prophylaxis) = 0 (i.e., no difference for treatment under the 2 prophylactic regimens. X' = (ABR+0.5)^(1/2)

outcome.title: Mean Difference of Transformed Annualized Bleeding Rate Between On-Demand and Standard Prophylaxis Treatment Regimens
outcome.description: Annualized bleed rates were transformed using the square root of the number of bleeding episodes observed (X bleeds/year), X′ = √(X + 0.5). This transformation was performed to stabilize the variance and align the sample distribution with the assumption of normality inherent in using the paired t-test. Mean Difference of Transformed Annualized Bleeding Rate (TABR) = (On-Demand Treatment TABR) - (Standard Prophylaxis Treatment TABR). Participants from the On-Demand portion of the study were subsequently randomized to either Standard Prophylaxis or PK-Driven Prophylaxis, (i.e the same participants were analyzed across the two measurement time periods).
outcome.time_frame: On-demand 6 months (± 2 weeks); followed by Prophylaxis 12 months (± 2 weeks)

group.title: On-Demand Versus Standard Prophylaxis
group.description: On-demand: rAHF-PFM was to be used for the treatment of bleeding episodes according to the severity and type of episode by the protocol-recommended dosing until the episode resolved: superficial (10-20 IU/kg every 12-14 hours), minor joint (20-40 IU/kg every 12-14 hours), deep muscle (30-60 IU/kg every 12-14 hours), major joint or life-threatening (60-100 IU/kg every 8-12 hours), genitourinary, Gastrointestinal (GI), and intracranial (60-100 IU/kg every 8-12 hours) Standard Prophylaxis: 20-40 IU/kg (every 48 ± 6 hours), exact regimen to be determined by the investigator

measure.title: Mean Difference of Transformed Annualized Bleeding Rate Between On-Demand and Standard Prophylaxis Treatment Regimens
measure.description: Annualized bleed rates were transformed using the square root of the number of bleeding episodes observed (X bleeds/year), X′ = √(X + 0.5). This transformation was performed to stabilize the variance and align the sample distribution with the assumption of normality inherent in using the paired t-test. Mean Difference of Transformed Annualized Bleeding Rate (TABR) = (On-Demand Treatment TABR) - (Standard Prophylaxis Treatment TABR). Participants from the On-Demand portion of the study were subsequently randomized to either Standard Prophylaxis or PK-Driven Prophylaxis, (i.e the same participants were analyzed across the two measurement time periods).

analysis.p_value_desc: 2-sided paired T-tests were done comparing transformed annualized bleeding rates between On-Demand and Prophylaxis regimens.

outcome.title: Mean Difference of Transformed Annualized Bleeding Rate Between On-Demand and PK-Driven Prophylaxis Treatment Regimens
outcome.description: Annualized bleed rates were transformed using the square root of the number of bleeding episodes observed (X bleeds/year), X′ = √(X + 0.5). This transformation was performed to stabilize the variance and align the sample distribution with the assumption of normality inherent in using the paired t-test. Mean Difference of Transformed Annualized Bleeding Rate (TABR) = (On-Demand Treatment TABR) - (PK-Driven Prophylaxis Treatment TABR) Participants from the On-Demand portion of the study were subsequently randomized to either Standard Prophylaxis or PK-Driven Prophylaxis, (i.e the same participants were analyzed across the two measurement time periods).

group.title: On-Demand Regimen
group.description: rAHF-PFM was to be used for the treatment of bleeding episodes according to the severity and type of episode by the protocol-recommended dosing until the episode resolved: superficial (10-20 IU/kg every 12-14 hours), minor joint (20-40 IU/kg every 12-14 hours), deep muscle (30-60 IU/kg every 12-14 hours), major joint or life-threatening (60-100 IU/kg every 8-12 hours), genitourinary, GI, and intracranial (60-100 IU/kg every 8-12 hours)

group.title: Standard Prophylaxis
group.description: 20-40 IU/kg (every 48 ± 6 hours), exact regimen to be determined by the investigator

group.title: PK-Driven Prophylaxis
group.description: 20-80 IU/kg (every 72 ± 6 hours), exact regimen to be determined by the sponsor

measure.title: Assessment of Hemostasis for Treatment of Bleeding Episodes
measure.population: Hemostatic Efficacy Rating Analysis Set (Participants with bleeding episodes that were rated)

outcome.title: Total Area Under the Curve (AUC)
outcome.description: Total AUC estimated by AUC 0-48h plus an area extrapolated from the log-linear regression model
outcome.time_frame: Pharmacokinetic evaluations: 30 minutes pre-infusion up to 48 hours post-infusion
outcome.population: Intent to Treat Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set

measure.title: Total Area Under the Curve (AUC)
measure.description: Total AUC estimated by AUC 0-48h plus an area extrapolated from the log-linear regression model
measure.population: Intent to Treat Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set

outcome.title: Area Under the Curve
outcome.description: Area under the factor VIII (FVIII) plasma concentration versus time curve (AUC) from 0 to 48 hours estimated using the linear trapezoidal method
outcome.time_frame: Pharmacokinetic evaluations: 30 minutes pre-infusion up to 48 hours post-infusion
outcome.population: Intent to Treat Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set

measure.title: Area Under the Curve
measure.description: Area under the factor VIII (FVIII) plasma concentration versus time curve (AUC) from 0 to 48 hours estimated using the linear trapezoidal method
measure.population: Intent to Treat Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set

outcome.title: Maximum Plasma Concentration (C-max)
outcome.description: Maximal Factor VIII Concentration After Infusion
outcome.time_frame: Within 1 hour post-infusion
outcome.population: Intent to Treat Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set

measure.title: Maximum Plasma Concentration (C-max)
measure.description: Maximal Factor VIII Concentration After Infusion
measure.population: Intent to Treat Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set

outcome.title: Adjusted Incremental Recovery (IR)
outcome.description: Change in factor VIII concentration from pre- to post-infusion at initial and termination study visits. Adjusted IR defined as: [Cmax (IU/dL) – pre-infusion FVIII (IU/dL)]/dose (IU/kg)
outcome.time_frame: 30 minutes pre-infusion to 48 hours post-infusion
outcome.population: Intent to Treat Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set

measure.title: Adjusted Incremental Recovery (IR)
measure.description: Change in factor VIII concentration from pre- to post-infusion at initial and termination study visits. Adjusted IR defined as: [Cmax (IU/dL) – pre-infusion FVIII (IU/dL)]/dose (IU/kg)
measure.population: Intent to Treat Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set

outcome.title: Terminal Half-life
outcome.description: Computed from the regression slope in the terminal phase of the model. Terminal half life is the time it takes for the plasma concentration or the amount of drug in the body to be reduced by 50%.
outcome.time_frame: Pharmacokinetic evaluations: 30 minutes pre-infusion up to 48 hours post-infusion
outcome.population: Intent to Treat Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set

measure.title: Terminal Half-life
measure.description: Computed from the regression slope in the terminal phase of the model. Terminal half life is the time it takes for the plasma concentration or the amount of drug in the body to be reduced by 50%.
measure.population: Intent to Treat Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set

outcome.title: Weight-Adjusted Clearance
outcome.description: Computed as the weight-adjusted dose divided by total AUC
outcome.time_frame: Pharmacokinetic evaluations: 30 minutes pre-infusion up to 48 hours post-infusion
outcome.population: Intent to Treat Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set

measure.title: Weight-Adjusted Clearance
measure.description: Computed as the weight-adjusted dose divided by total AUC
measure.population: Intent to Treat Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set

outcome.title: Mean Residence Time
outcome.description: Computed as total Area Under the Moment Curve (AUMC) divided by the total AUC
outcome.time_frame: Pharmacokinetic evaluations: 30 minutes pre-infusion up to 48 hours post-infusion
outcome.population: Intent to Treat Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set

measure.title: Mean Residence Time
measure.description: Computed as total Area Under the Moment Curve (AUMC) divided by the total AUC
measure.population: Intent to Treat Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set

outcome.title: Volume of Distribution at Steady State
outcome.description: Computed as weight-adjusted clearance * mean residence time
outcome.time_frame: Pharmacokinetic evaluations: 30 minutes pre-infusion up to 48 hours post-infusion
outcome.population: Intent to Treat Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set

measure.title: Volume of Distribution at Steady State
measure.description: Computed as weight-adjusted clearance * mean residence time
measure.population: Intent to Treat Pharmacokinetic Analysis Set

outcome.title: Baseline Health-related Quality of Life (HRQoL) Scores: PF, RP, BP, GH, VT, SF, RE, MH, PCS, and MCS
outcome.description: Physical Functioning (PF); Role Limitation Due to Physical Health (RP); Bodily Pain (BP); General Health (GH); Vitality (VT); Social Functioning (SF); Role Limitation Due to Emotional Problems (RE); Mental Health (MH), Physical Component Score (PCS); Mental Component Score (MCS). Baseline SF-36v1 Scores, where data available. Scores range 0-100, higher scores represent better health. There is no total overall score; scoring is done for subscores and summary scores. The raw data from the SF-36 items were transformed to norm based scores for each of the 8 HRQoL/SF-36 health domain scores.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline

measure.title: Baseline Health-related Quality of Life (HRQoL) Scores: PF, RP, BP, GH, VT, SF, RE, MH, PCS, and MCS
measure.description: Physical Functioning (PF); Role Limitation Due to Physical Health (RP); Bodily Pain (BP); General Health (GH); Vitality (VT); Social Functioning (SF); Role Limitation Due to Emotional Problems (RE); Mental Health (MH), Physical Component Score (PCS); Mental Component Score (MCS). Baseline SF-36v1 Scores, where data available. Scores range 0-100, higher scores represent better health. There is no total overall score; scoring is done for subscores and summary scores. The raw data from the SF-36 items were transformed to norm based scores for each of the 8 HRQoL/SF-36 health domain scores.

outcome.title: Health-related Quality of Life (HRQoL) Scores: PF, RP, BP, GH, VT, SF, RE, MH, PCS, and MCS at the End of Treatment Regimens
outcome.description: Physical Functioning (PF); Role Limitation Due to Physical Health (RP); Bodily Pain (BP); General Health (GH); Vitality (VT); Social Functioning (SF); Role Limitation Due to Emotional Problems (RE); Mental Health (MH), Physical Component Score (PCS); Mental Component Score (MCS). Baseline SF-36v1 Scores, where data available. Scores range 0-100, higher scores represent better health. There is no total overall score; scoring is done for subscores and summary scores. The raw data from the SF-36 items were transformed to norm based scores for each of the 8 HRQoL/SF-36 health domain scores.
outcome.time_frame: End of on-demand treatment period (6 months) and at study termination (approximately 18 months)

group.title: On-Demand Treatment
group.description: rAHF-PFM was to be used for the treatment of bleeding episodes according to the severity and type of episode by the protocol-recommended dosing until the episode resolved: superficial (10-20 IU/kg every 12-14 hours), minor joint (20-40 IU/kg every 12-14 hours), deep muscle (30-60 IU/kg every 12-14 hours), major joint or life-threatening (60-100 IU/kg every 8-12 hours), genitourinary, GI, and intracranial (60-100 IU/kg every 8-12 hours

group.title: Standard Prophylaxis
group.description: 20-40 IU/kg (every 48 ± 6 hours), exact regimen to be determined by the investigator

group.title: PK-Driven Prophylaxis
group.description: 20-80 IU/kg (every 72 ± 6 hours), exact regimen to be determined by the sponsor

group.title: Any Prophylaxis Treatment
group.description: Any Prophylaxis Treatment (either Standard Prophylaxis or PK-Driven Prophylaxis) Standard Prophylaxis: 20-40 IU/kg (every 48 ± 6 hours), exact regimen to be determined by the investigator PK-Driven Prophylaxis: 20-80 IU/kg (every 72 ± 6 hours), exact regimen to be determined by the sponsor

measure.title: Health-related Quality of Life (HRQoL) Scores: PF, RP, BP, GH, VT, SF, RE, MH, PCS, and MCS at the End of Treatment Regimens
measure.description: Physical Functioning (PF); Role Limitation Due to Physical Health (RP); Bodily Pain (BP); General Health (GH); Vitality (VT); Social Functioning (SF); Role Limitation Due to Emotional Problems (RE); Mental Health (MH), Physical Component Score (PCS); Mental Component Score (MCS). Baseline SF-36v1 Scores, where data available. Scores range 0-100, higher scores represent better health. There is no total overall score; scoring is done for subscores and summary scores. The raw data from the SF-36 items were transformed to norm based scores for each of the 8 HRQoL/SF-36 health domain scores.

outcome.title: HRQoL Scores Change From On-Demand Treatment Regimen Period Through Prophylaxis Period
outcome.description: Differences in health domain scores = (End of on-demand treatment) – (End of prophylaxis regimen). A negative value for the median difference equates to a larger domain score for the prophylaxis regimen Physical Functioning (PF); Role Limitation Due to Physical Health (RP); Bodily Pain (BP); General Health (GH); Vitality (VT); Social Functioning (SF); Role Limitation Due to Emotional Problems (RE); Mental Health (MH), Physical Component Score (PCS); Mental Component Score (MCS). Scores range 0-100, higher scores represent better health. There is no total overall score; scoring is done for subscores and summary scores. The raw data from the SF-36 items were transformed to norm based scores for each of the 8 HRQoL/SF-36 health domain scores.
outcome.time_frame: End of on-demand treatment period (6 months) and at study termination (approximately 18 months)
outcome.population: Pharmacoeconomic Analysis Set ≥14 Years and Older

measure.title: HRQoL Scores Change From On-Demand Treatment Regimen Period Through Prophylaxis Period
measure.description: Differences in health domain scores = (End of on-demand treatment) – (End of prophylaxis regimen). A negative value for the median difference equates to a larger domain score for the prophylaxis regimen Physical Functioning (PF); Role Limitation Due to Physical Health (RP); Bodily Pain (BP); General Health (GH); Vitality (VT); Social Functioning (SF); Role Limitation Due to Emotional Problems (RE); Mental Health (MH), Physical Component Score (PCS); Mental Component Score (MCS). Scores range 0-100, higher scores represent better health. There is no total overall score; scoring is done for subscores and summary scores. The raw data from the SF-36 items were transformed to norm based scores for each of the 8 HRQoL/SF-36 health domain scores.
measure.population: Pharmacoeconomic Analysis Set ≥14 Years and Older

outcome.title: Median Annualized Bleed Rate Estimates From Each of the 1 Year Prophylaxis Regimens
outcome.description: Participants were Randomized to Receive 1 of the 2 Following Prophylaxis Regimens (Part 2 of the study): Standard prophylaxis- infusions every 48 ±6 hours, dosed at 20 to 40 IU/kg. PK-driven prophylaxis- infusions every 72 ±6 hours dosed at 20 to 80 IU/kg.
outcome.time_frame: 12 months ±2 weeks

group.title: PK-Driven Prophylaxis
group.description: PK-driven prophylaxis regimen dosed at 20 to 80 IU/kg every 72 ±6 hours

group.title: Standard Prophylaxis
group.description: Standard prophylaxis regimen dosed at 20 to 40 IU/kg every 48 ±6 hours

measure.title: Median Annualized Bleed Rate Estimates From Each of the 1 Year Prophylaxis Regimens
measure.description: Participants were Randomized to Receive 1 of the 2 Following Prophylaxis Regimens (Part 2 of the study): Standard prophylaxis- infusions every 48 ±6 hours, dosed at 20 to 40 IU/kg. PK-driven prophylaxis- infusions every 72 ±6 hours dosed at 20 to 80 IU/kg.

outcome.title: Bodily Pain HRQoL Scores Change From On-Demand Period Through Prophylaxis Period
outcome.description: Change = (End of on-demand treatment) – (End of prophylaxis regimen). A negative value for the median difference equates to a larger domain score for the prophylaxis regimen. Scores range 0-100, higher scores represent better health. There is no total overall score; scoring is done for subscores and summary scores. The raw data from the SF-36 items were transformed to norm based scores.
outcome.time_frame: End of on-demand treatment period (6 months) and at study termination (approximately 18 months)
outcome.population: Pharmacoeconomic analysis set for participants ≥14 years of age

group.title: ≥14 Years of Age
group.description: After an on-demand treatment period, participants were randomized to 1 of 2 prophylactic regimens for 12 months. The standard prophylactic regimen was dosed at 20 to 40 IU/kg every 48 ±6 hours, and the PK-driven prophylaxis regimen was dosed at 20 to 80 IU/kg every 72 ±6 hours.

measure.title: Bodily Pain HRQoL Scores Change From On-Demand Period Through Prophylaxis Period
measure.description: Change = (End of on-demand treatment) – (End of prophylaxis regimen). A negative value for the median difference equates to a larger domain score for the prophylaxis regimen. Scores range 0-100, higher scores represent better health. There is no total overall score; scoring is done for subscores and summary scores. The raw data from the SF-36 items were transformed to norm based scores.
measure.population: Pharmacoeconomic analysis set for participants ≥14 years of age

analysis.p_value_desc: Due to multiple hypotheses testing results, adjusted alpha values are set to α*=0.005 (0.05/10). Adjustments take into account 10 hypotheses tests between On-Demand and any Prophylaxis. Statistically significant results are considered p-values < α*

outcome.title: Physical Component Scores (PCS) HRQoL Scores Change From On-Demand Period Through Prophylaxis Period
outcome.description: Change = (End of on-demand treatment) – (End of prophylaxis regimen) A negative value for the median difference equates to a larger domain score for the prophylaxis regimen. Scores range 0-100, higher scores represent better health. There is no total overall score; scoring is done for subscores and summary scores. The raw data from the SF-36 items were transformed to norm based scores.
outcome.time_frame: End of on-demand treatment period (6 months) and at study termination (approximately 18 months)
outcome.population: Pharmacoeconomic analysis set for participants ≥14 years of age

group.title: ≥14 Years of Age
group.description: After an on-demand treatment period, participants were randomized to 1 of 2 prophylactic regimens for 12 months. The standard prophylactic regimen was dosed at 20 to 40 IU/kg every 48 ±6 hours, and the PK-driven prophylaxis regimen was dosed at 20 to 80 IU/kg every 72 ±6 hours.

measure.title: Physical Component Scores (PCS) HRQoL Scores Change From On-Demand Period Through Prophylaxis Period
measure.description: Change = (End of on-demand treatment) – (End of prophylaxis regimen) A negative value for the median difference equates to a larger domain score for the prophylaxis regimen. Scores range 0-100, higher scores represent better health. There is no total overall score; scoring is done for subscores and summary scores. The raw data from the SF-36 items were transformed to norm based scores.
measure.population: Pharmacoeconomic analysis set for participants ≥14 years of age

analysis.p_value_desc: Due to multiple hypotheses testing results, adjusted alpha values are set to α*=0.005 (0.05/10). Adjustments take into account 10 hypotheses tests between On-Demand and any Prophylaxis. Statistically significant results are considered p-values < α*

outcome.title: Median (IQR) Annualized Bleed Rates
outcome.description: Bleed rates (number of bleeding episodes per subject) were annualized to account for the varying number of days a subject may have actually been on each regimen.
outcome.time_frame: On-demand 6 months (± 2 weeks); Prophylaxis 12 months (± 2 weeks)

group.title: On-Demand Regimen
group.description: After the initial PK study, a 6 month period of on-demand treatment was conducted (Part 1)

group.title: Standard Prophylaxis
group.description: Dosed at 20 to 40 IU/kg every 48 ±6 hours for 12 months (Part 2)

group.title: PK-driven Prophylaxis
group.description: Dosed at 20 to 80 IU/kg every 72 ±6 hours for 12 months (Part 2)

group.title: Any Prophylaxis
group.description: Either Standard or PK-driven Prophylaxis

measure.title: Median (IQR) Annualized Bleed Rates
measure.description: Bleed rates (number of bleeding episodes per subject) were annualized to account for the varying number of days a subject may have actually been on each regimen.

reported_events.time_frame: Throughout the study period (4 years and 5 months)

group.title: On-Demand
group.description: On-demand: rAHF-PFM was to be used for the treatment of bleeding episodes according to the severity and type of episode by the protocol-recommended dosing until the episode resolved: superficial (10-20 IU/kg every 12-14 hours), minor joint (20-40 IU/kg every 12-14 hours), deep muscle (30-60 IU/kg every 12-14 hours), major joint or life-threatening (60-100 IU/kg every 8-12 hours), genitourinary, GI, and intracranial (60-100 IU/kg every 8-12 hours)

group.title: Standard Prophylaxis
group.description: Standard prophylaxis regimen dosed at 20 to 40 IU/kg (every 48 ±6 hours), exact regimen to be determined by the investigator

group.title: PK-Driven Prophylaxis
group.description: PK-driven prophylaxis regimen dosed at 20 to 80 IU/kg (every 72 ±6 hours) exact regimen to be determined by the sponsor

group.title: SAEs Outside of the 3 Treatment Arms

event.description: This event was unconfirmed and therefore did not meet protocol definition for a Factor VIII inhibitor.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Baxter’s agreements with PIs may vary per requirements of the individual PI, but contain common elements. For this study, PIs are restricted from independently publishing results until the earlier of the primary multicenter publication or ≤2 years after study completion. Baxter requires a review of results communications (e.g., for confidential information) ≥60 days prior to submission or communication. Baxter may request an additional delay of ≤60 days (e.g., intellectual property protection)

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Wing-Yen Wong, MD, Global Sr Medical Dir Hemophilia
